rules: Rule1: Either person1 has a portrait in artwork1 or it is the opening night of event1.
Rule2: Provided that artist1 signs artwork1, it follows that artist1 paints artwork1.
Rule3: Collector1 buys artwork1 or collector1 loans artwork1 to gallery1.
Rule4: Assuming collector1 loans artwork1 to gallery1, then, under the condition that it is not the opening night of event1, artist1 signs artwork1.
Rule5: Should collector1 insure artwork1, then artwork1 is displayed in gallery1.
Rule6: If artwork1 is authentic, then, given that collector1 buys artwork1, collector1 insures it.
Rule7: Artwork1 is vandalized or it is the opening night of event1.
Rule8: Either guard1 guards artwork1 or gallery1 has an alarm for artwork1.
Rule9: Given that gallery1 has an alarm for artwork1, then artwork1 is not vandalized.
Rule10: If person1 drinks wine from alcohol1, then it is not the case that person1 has a portrait in artwork1.
Rule11: Person1 drinks wine from alcohol1 or person1 attends gala event1.
Rule12: Provided that framer1 frames artwork1, framer1 restores artwork1.
Rule13: If framer1 restores artwork1, then artwork1 is not stolen.

Rule14: If detective1 investigates artwork1, then, assuming it is not the case that (artwork1 is displayed in gallery1 or, if it is not the opening night of event1, then artist1 signs artwork1), it follows that artwork1 is forged.
Rule15: Detective1 investigates artwork1 or conservator1 analyzes artwork1.
Rule16: If conservator1 analyzes artwork1, then conservator1 tests artwork1.

Rule17: Should conservator1 test artwork1, then, given that it is not the case that (artwork1 is displayed in gallery1 or, if it is not the opening night of event1, then artist1 signs artwork1), artwork1 is forged.
Rule18: Critic1 reviews artwork1 or critic1 photographs artwork1.
Rule19: Given that critic1 photographs artwork1, then, should it not be the opening night of event1, artist1 signs artwork1.
Rule20: In the event that critic1 publishes artwork1, then artwork1 is displayed in gallery1.
Rule21: Assuming editor1 is the editor of magazine1, then editor1 approves critic1.
Rule22: If editor1 approves critic1, then magazine1 prints review1.
Rule23: Whenever subscriber1 reads review1, then, assuming magazine1 prints review1 and critic1 reviews artwork1, critic1 publishes it.
Rule24: Gallery1 hosts event1, or, if it is not the opening night of event1, then artist1 paints artwork1.
Rule25: Gallery1 caters event1, or gallery1 decorates for event1, or, if gallery1 hosts event1, then it invites person1.
Rule26: Provided person2 admires artwork1, then, if person1 attends gala event1, person1 does not have a portrait in artwork1.
Rule27: Person2 admires artwork1 or person2 criticizes artwork1.
Rule28: Assuming person1 spills alcohol1, then staff1 does not clean alcohol1.
Rule29: Person1 spills alcohol1, or gallery1 does not cater event1.
Rule30: Gallery1 bans person1, or gallery1 reimburses person1, or, if person1 spills alcohol1, then staff1 cleans it.
Rule31: If bidder1 bids on artwork1 at auction1, then artwork1 is displayed in gallery1.
Rule32: Bidder1 bids on artwork1 at auction1 or bidder1 examines artwork1.
Rule33: Should bidder1 authenticate artwork1, then, if it is not the opening night of event1, artist1 signs artwork1.
Rule34: If bidder1 wins the auction for artwork1, then, given that bidder1 examines artwork1, bidder1 authenticates it.
Rule35: Provided bidder1 pays for artwork1, then bidder1 wins the auction for artwork1.
Rule36: If person3 is the curator of gallery1, then, provided person2 criticizes artwork1, then, should person1 attend gala event1, person1 does not have a portrait in artwork1.
Rule37: In the event that person4 is the owner of gallery1, then, under the condition that person2 criticizes artwork1 and person1 attends gala event1, person1 does not have a portrait in artwork1.
Rule38: Provided person3 hangs artwork1 in gallery1, then person3 is the curator of gallery1 or person4 is the owner of gallery1.
Rule39: Gallery1 serves alcohol1 at event1 or person3 hangs artwork1 in gallery1.
Rule40: Should it not be the case that (if guard1 guards artwork1 then artwork1 is not vandalized), then artwork1 is stolen.
Rule41: If it is not the case that (if subscriber1 subscribes to magazine1 then subscriber1 reads review1), then subscriber1 cancels magazine1.
Rule42: If it is not the case that (if subscriber1 subscribes to magazine1 then subscriber1 reads review1), then subscriber1 does not cancel magazine1.
Rule43: Under the condition that it is not the opening night of event1, artist1 does not paint artwork1.
facts: Fact3: Editor1 is the editor of magazine1.
Fact6: Artwork1 is not displayed in gallery1.
Fact8: Gallery1 does not invite person1.
Fact9: Gallery1 does not decorate for event1.
Fact10: Gallery1 does not reimburse person1.
Fact11: Gallery1 does not ban person1.
Fact12: Gallery1 does not serve alcohol1 at event1.

question: It is the opening night of event1.
